thread.title: Trade Deal Eases Way for U.S., South Korea to Collaborate on North

author: Kwanwoo Jun
title: Trade Deal Eases Way for U.S., South Korea to Collaborate on North
text:
SEOULâ€”South Korea became the first country to successfully negotiate a permanent exemption to new U.S. steel tariffs this weekend in part because the two allies have a bigger challenge ahead: disarming North Korea.
Washington and Seoul had been in the awkward position of scuffling over trade while working toward summits between South Korean President Moon Jae-in and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, followed by a meeting between Mr. Kim and President Donald Trump.
... RELATED VIDEO Trump Accepts Invitation to Meet North Korea's Kim Jong Un In a historic diplomatic breakthrough, President Donald Trump accepted an invitation from North Korean leader Kim Jong Un to meet "as soon as possible." News of the summit was announced by a senior South Korean official at the White House Thursday evening.
